result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Barrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances with out valid prescription
--take all prescribed medication as directed
--to undergo random drug/ alcohol screens
--to undergo assessment, treatment or  counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence 
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A. Barrett

records.addlTxt:
Conflict reivew worksheet
Criminal case settlement

Case called at 9:51 [mo] 
Defendant Robert A. Barrett in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County  Assistant District Attorney, DA Wambach  did prosecute Mr. Barrett. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
The Court reviews court record.
ADA Hall indicates she has had a PTC with Mr. Barrett and an offer was made, but has not received a response. 
Mr. Barrett indicates he wishes to accept the offer made by the State.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall 

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 12 months, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances with out valid prescription
--take all prescribed medication as directed
--to undergo random drug/ alcohol screens
--to undergo assessment, treatment or  counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence 
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  1  days
Apply $500 cash bail toward payment of costs. Refund any balance to payor
recess: 10:13am
Status conference on March 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 10:02 am [Clerk SH]
[Judge Randy R. Koschnick presiding for BrII]
Defendant Robert A. Barrett in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Right to counsel given
Mr. Barrett indicates that he would like to proceed without counsel at this time
Constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Court reviews right to counsel. Mr. Barrett waives this right; Court accepts this waiver and finds him competent to represent himself
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court continues a $500 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
Recess: 10:10 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 3/4/15 at 1:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for - Send notices
